summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 4, 2019, discussing a New York Post article about an anonymous 'John Doe' who is petitioning a judge to avoid being named in a case related to Jeffrey Epstein's 'gal pal.' The email shows FBI personnel in New York and CID (Criminal Investigative Division) seeking to identify this individual.

events.title: John Doe petitions judge in Epstein-related case
events.description: A New York Post article reports that an anonymous 'John Doe' is begging a judge not to reveal his name in a case involving Jeffrey Epstein's 'gal pal.'

keyFacts: An internal FBI email from September 4, 2019, shows agents discussing a New York Post article about an anonymous 'John Doe' in an Epstein-related case.
The 'John Doe' is attempting to prevent his name from being publicly revealed in a case connected to Jeffrey Epstein's 'gal pal.'
FBI personnel from New York and the Criminal Investigative Division (CID) are inquiring about the identity of this individual, indicating investigative interest.
The document is a forwarded email, highlighting internal FBI communication and monitoring of media reports related to the Epstein case.
